questionnaire.name: 4. theBIKEnet Safety Behaviour - How you protect yourself

sections.title: theBIKEnet Safety Behaviour Questionnaire
sections.description:
üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This fourth questionnaire explores how you protect yourself and behave in traffic, including your confidence, safety practices, and reactions to different road situations. Understanding these everyday strategies helps us identify habits and needs that can guide safer riding behaviours and better infrastructure design.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about the theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Cycling Confidence
sections.description: How confident and comfortable you feel when handling your bicycle or e-scooter in different traffic and environmental conditions.

questions.text: I am confident in my ability to control my bicycle or e-scooter in different traffic situations.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: I am confident in my ability to handle my bicycle or e-scooter at higher speeds or on downhill sections.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: I feel anxious or tense when dealing with complex traffic situations while cycling or riding an e-scooter.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: I feel comfortable sharing the road with motor traffic when cycling or riding an e-scooter.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

sections.title: Avoidance and Adaptive Behaviour
sections.description: When and where you choose to ride, and what strategies you use to stay safe.

questions.text: What actions do you take to feel safer when cycling or riding an e-scooter?

options.text: Avoid riding at night or in low-light conditions
Pay more attention to traffic and surroundings
Use sidewalks or pedestrian areas (even if not allowed)
Ride against the traffic flow (wrong-way riding)
Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Would you be willing to break traffic rules when cycling or riding an e-scooter in some situations if you consider it safer?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Which traffic rules do you occasionally disregard when cycling or riding an e-scooter?

options.text: Crossing at red lights (e.g., when you think it is safe)
Going the wrong way on one-way streets
Using headphones or earphones in a way that reduces awareness of traffic
Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Which types of road users most negatively affect your sense of safety?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

sections.title: Protective Behaviour
sections.description: How often and in what ways you protect yourself while cycling or using an e-scooter.

questions.text: How often do you wear a helmet when cycling or riding an e-scooter?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Which safety equipment do you use regularly?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Do you usually cycle or ride an e-scooter with lights or reflective items during the day?

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Where do you usually position yourself when waiting at red lights when cycling or riding an e-scooter?

options.text: In front of cars, in the lane
Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: How do you deal with tram tracks or similar obstacles when cycling or riding an e-scooter?

options.text: I slow down and cross perpendicularly
I avoid them by changing route or lane
I cross at a shallow angle without slowing down
There are no tram tracks on my usual routes
Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

sections.title: Motivation and Social Norms
sections.description: Your reasons and social influences related to using safety equipment such as helmets or lights.

questions.text: I use safety equipment because it makes me feel safer when cycling or riding an e-scooter.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: I use safety equipment because I believe it is required by law or regulation when cycling or riding an e-scooter.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: I do not think safety equipment is necessary for short trips when cycling or riding an e-scooter.

options.text: Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle or an e-scooter)

questions.text: Most people I know use helmets or lights when cycling.

üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This fourth questionnaire explores how you protect yourself and behave in traffic, including your confidence, safety practices, and reactions to different road situations. Understanding these everyday strategies helps us identify habits and needs that can guide safer riding behaviours and better infrastructure design.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

it.#4. theBIKEnet Safety Behaviour - How yo: 4. theBIKEnet Comportamenti di Sicurezza - Come ti proteggi
it.#üö≤ <b>theBIKEnet</b> is a public rese:
üö≤ theBIKEnet √® un progetto di ricerca pubblica che studia come le persone si spostano in bicicletta nelle citt√† - unendo scienza, tecnologia ed esperienza quotidiana. Il nostro obiettivo √® rendere la mobilit√† urbana pi√π sicura, equa e sostenibile per tutte le persone.

Questo quarto questionario analizza come ti proteggi e come ti comporti nel traffico, considerando la tua fiducia, le pratiche di sicurezza e le reazioni in diverse situazioni stradali. Comprendere queste strategie quotidiane ci aiuta a individuare abitudini e bisogni che possono orientare comportamenti pi√π sicuri e una migliore progettazione delle infrastrutture.

La partecipazione √® completamente volontaria e anonima. Le informazioni fornite saranno utilizzate solo a fini scientifici ed educativi.

Scopri di pi√π sul progetto theBIKEnet
it.#How confident and comfortable you feel: Quanto ti senti sicuro/a e a tuo agio nel gestire la tua bici o il tuo monopattino elettrico in diverse condizioni di traffico e ambientali.
it.#I am confident in my ability to control: Sono sicuro/a della mia capacit√† di controllare la bici o il monopattino elettrico in diverse situazioni di traffico.
it.#I am confident in my ability to handle: Sono sicuro/a della mia capacit√† di gestire la bici o il monopattino elettrico a velocit√† pi√π elevate o in tratti in discesa.
it.#I feel anxious or tense when dealing wi: Mi sento ansioso/a o teso/a quando affronto situazioni di traffico complesse andando in bici o in monopattino elettrico.
it.#I feel comfortable sharing the road wit: Mi sento a mio agio nel condividere la strada con il traffico motorizzato quando vado in bici o in monopattino elettrico.
it.#When and where you choose to ride, and: Quando e dove scegli di muoverti, e quali strategie adotti per sentirti al sicuro.
it.#What actions do you take to feel safer: Quali azioni adotti per sentirti pi√π sicuro/a quando vai in bici o in monopattino elettrico?
it.#Avoid riding at night or in low-light c: Evito di muovermi di notte o in condizioni di scarsa illuminazione
it.#Use protective gear (helmet, reflective: Uso dispositivi di protezione (casco, abbigliamento riflettente)
it.#Ride more slowly or cautiously: Vado pi√π lentamente o con maggiore cautela
it.#Pay more attention to traffic and surro: Presto maggiore attenzione al traffico e all‚Äôambiente circostante
it.#Use sidewalks or pedestrian areas (even: Uso marciapiedi o aree pedonali (anche quando non √® consentito)
it.#Avoid left turns or roundabouts: Evito svolte a sinistra o rotatorie
it.#Ride against the traffic flow (wrong-wa: Circolo in senso contrario al traffico (contromano)
it.#Would you be willing to break traffic r: Saresti disposto/a a infrangere alcune regole del traffico andando in bici o in monopattino elettrico, in determinate situazioni, se lo considerassi pi√π sicuro?
it.#Which traffic rules do you occasionally: Quali regole del traffico ignori occasionalmente quando vai in bici o in monopattino elettrico?
it.#Crossing at red lights (e.g., when you: Attraverso con il semaforo rosso (ad esempio quando lo considero sicuro)
it.#Using sidewalks or pedestrian-only infr: Uso marciapiedi o infrastrutture riservate ai pedoni
it.#Going the wrong way on one-way streets: Procedo in senso vietato nelle strade a senso unico
it.#Using headphones or earphones in a way: Uso cuffie o auricolari in modo da ridurre l‚Äôattenzione al traffico
it.#Which types of road users most negative: Quali tipologie di utenti della strada influenzano maggiormente in modo negativo la tua sensazione di sicurezza?
it.#How often and in what ways you protect: Con quale frequenza e in che modo ti proteggi quando vai in bici o utilizzi un monopattino elettrico.
it.#How often do you wear a helmet when cyc: Con quale frequenza indossi il casco quando vai in bici o in monopattino elettrico?
it.#Which safety equipment do you use regul: Quali dispositivi di sicurezza utilizzi regolarmente?
it.#Do you usually cycle or ride an e-scoot: Usi di solito luci o elementi riflettenti anche di giorno quando vai in bici o in monopattino elettrico?
it.#Where do you usually position yourself: Dove ti posizioni di solito quando aspetti al semaforo rosso andando in bici o in monopattino elettrico?
it.#Beside cars, near the curb: Accanto alle auto, vicino al margine della carreggiata
it.#On the sidewalk or crosswalk: Sul marciapiede o sulle strisce pedonali
it.#How do you deal with tram tracks or sim: Come affronti i binari del tram o ostacoli simili quando vai in bici o in monopattino elettrico?
it.#I avoid them by changing route or lane: Li evito cambiando percorso o corsia
it.#I cross at a shallow angle without slow: Li attraverso con un‚Äôangolazione ridotta senza rallentare
it.#There are no tram tracks on my usual ro: Non ci sono binari del tram sui miei percorsi abituali
it.#Your reasons and social influences rela: Le tue motivazioni e le influenze sociali legate all‚Äôuso di dispositivi di sicurezza come casco o luci.
it.#I use safety equipment because it makes: Uso i dispositivi di sicurezza perch√© mi fanno sentire pi√π sicuro/a quando vado in bici o in monopattino elettrico.
it.#I use safety equipment because I believ: Uso i dispositivi di sicurezza perch√© ritengo che siano richiesti dalla legge o dai regolamenti quando vado in bici o in monopattino elettrico.
it.#I do not think safety equipment is nece: Non ritengo necessari i dispositivi di sicurezza per spostamenti brevi quando vado in bici o in monopattino elettrico.
it.#Most people I know use helmets or light: La maggior parte delle persone che conosco usa casco o luci quando va in bicicletta.
it.#Not applicable (I do not use a bicycle: Non applicabile (non uso n√© la bicicletta n√© il monopattino elettrico)
